thread.title: Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy
thread.title_full: Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy

author: MICHAEL MAROT
title: Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy
text:
AJ Mast Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
New England Patriots tight end Scott Chandler (88) makes a catch over Indianapolis Colts cornerback Greg Toler (28) in the end zone in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. Offensive pass interference was called on the play. (AP Photo/AJ Mast) John Minchillo Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
New England Patriots cornerback Malcolm Butler (21) breaks up a pass to Indianapolis Colts wide receiver T.Y. Hilton (13) in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/John Minchillo) AJ Mast Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
Indianapolis Colts wide receiver T.Y. Hilton (13) scores a touchdown in front of New England Patriots cornerback Logan Ryan (26) in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/AJ Mast) AJ Mast Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
New England Patriots running back LeGarrette Blount (29) breaks away from Indianapolis Colts free safety Dwight Lowery (33) to score a touchdown in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/AJ Mast) AJ Mast Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
New England Patriots head coach Bill Belichick watches from the sideline in the first half of an NFL football game against the Indianapolis Colts in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/AJ Mast) John Minchillo Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
Indianapolis Colts wide receiver T.Y. Hilton (13) celebrates a touchdown with quarterback Andrew Luck (12) in the first half of an NFL football game against the New England Patriots in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/John Minchillo) AJ Mast Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
Indianapolis Colts strong safety Mike Adams (29) intercepts a pass from New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady (12) in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/AJ Mast) AJ Mast Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
Indianapolis Colts strong safety Mike Adams (29) scores a touchdown on an interception on a pass from New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/AJ Mast) John Minchillo Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
Indianapolis Colts strong safety Mike Adams (29) celebrates touchdown on an interception with inside linebacker Jerrell Freeman (50) in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/John Minchillo) John Minchillo Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy 
Indianapolis Colts defensive tackle Billy Winn (99) tackles New England Patriots running back LeGarrette Blount (29) in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/John Minchillo) Brady, Patriots take advantage of botched play to beat Indy Associated Press | 
INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Tom Brady found a way to stop talking about revenge Sunday night. 
He let the Colts take the air out of their own building with a bone-headed botched fake punt. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety.
